title: Synthetic Recap
body:
MIAMI — On a night where defense and physicality defined the Eastern Conference battle, one man authored a historic offensive masterpiece. Tim Hardaway didn’t just lead the Miami Heat to a 106-90 victory over the Indiana Pacers; he delivered a performance for the ages, pouring in a career-high and franchise-record 38 points and dishing out 10 assists in a stunning display of individual brilliance.

From the opening tip, Hardaway was uncontainable. He sliced through the Pacers’ defense, a blur of crossover dribbles and fearless drives. His shooting was equally lethal, connecting from deep with a regularity that left Indiana scrambling. Every time the Pacers threatened to close the gap, “T-Hard” answered, his playmaking elevating his teammates while his scoring broke their spirit.

While Hardaway orchestrated the offense, the Heat’s defense was typically brutal. Alonzo Mourning anchored the paint with 18 points and 12 rebounds, forming an impenetrable wall. The Pacers, led by Reggie Miller’s 19 points, simply had no counter for the hurricane that was Hardaway. His record-setting night energized the Miami Arena crowd and sent a clear message to the league.

In the end, the final score was almost a secondary detail. The real story was the 38 points flashing next to Hardaway’s name in the scorebook—a new, towering standard for a franchise on the rise. It was more than a win; it was a legendary statement from a point guard at the absolute peak of his powers.
